instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-2914: What is 820-2914? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> black screen after Tiresias?
threads.message:
Got  what I thought is a classic 2011 15inch  GPU issue. 

Machine looks clean turns on and chimes but just shows a white screen  

Removed board,  disabled  GPU by removing <RESISTOR>R8911</RESISTOR> fitted Tiresias,  pop board back in to test before adding brightness control wires and it turns on chimes back light comes on but all I get is a black screen,  tried logic board in known good working second machine same result. 

Is this a common issue,  a dead Tiresias or maybe not a GPU fault in the first place?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> black screen after Tiresias?
threads.message: I've also gone over the Tiresias solder joints twice and checked for shorts,  the fitting is immaculate

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> black screen after Tiresias?
threads.message:
In the first moment, did you get pure white, or classic Apple gray?
You can test reverting changes.

Just in case, do PRAM reset 2-3 times.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> black screen after Tiresias?
threads.message:
In the first moment, did you get pure white, or classic Apple gray? = Pure white

Put back <RESISTOR>R8911</RESISTOR> and removed  Tiresias ,

Now just getting the exact same behavior, Machine powers on, chimes I get back light but just a black screen,.
( Same on external monitor )

It also seems unresponsive to PRAM reset,I tried it a dozen times but I just get the single chime and backlight and no reboot or second chime it just hangs on this black screen with backlight no matter what I do like its hung until I force it off by holding the power button.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> black screen after Tiresias?
threads.message:
Pure white means no 3.3V going to LCD.
If you get black screen now, LCD should get that voltage; just check on video connector.

To discard a problem with Tiresias adapter, try disabling GPU in BIOS.
Don't forget to remove <RESISTOR>R8904</RESISTOR>/11 first.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> black screen after Tiresias?
threads.message:
can this be done with Medusa?

Iv just got one from Harold but not used it yet??

Don't forget to remove <RESISTOR>R8904</RESISTOR>/11 first.   Is it not just <RESISTOR>R8911</RESISTOR> I remove to disable GPU? This is the first I have seen <RESISTOR>R8904</RESISTOR> mentioned

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> black screen after Tiresias?
threads.message:
Removing one resistor is OK, but I prefer to remove both.
In fact, when I disable GPU, I remove and recover all MOSFETs and chip controllers from GPU power supplies.
There are also many filter caps to be reused.
First MUST confirm that board works correctly in UMA version.
For BIOS mod, I also recommend EFI password; as protection against PRAM reset.

Medusa has dedicated function to disable GPU for these boards.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> black screen after Tiresias?
threads.message:

I do have a plie of Tiresias that I would like to use to preserve brightness control.

threads.message:
Removed <RESISTOR>R8911</RESISTOR> again and tried a known good Triesas chip,  same deal. 

So now with or without the Triesas it powers on,  fan spin,  chime,  back light kicks in,  but no display.  

Also unable to do any kind of Pram reset it just dosent respond

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> black screen after Tiresias?
threads.message:
Try known good BIOS.
There may be EFI password...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> black screen after Tiresias?
threads.message:
Spent some time practicing with the medusa today, then used to put a good known bios and clean the ME on this one, put the Tiresias back on and boom, booted first time! 

Can't tell you how good that felt and how easy that was with the medusa in comparison to removing the efi chip to re programme! 


Worth every penny and thanks for the recommendation! 

Thanks for your help dude!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> black screen after Tiresias?
threads.message:
Iv'e got an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> here , It had a dead GPu and a damaged LCD connector, I replaced the LCD connector and added a  Tiresias , I'm now getting boot up fan spins, chime and backlight, as the one in this thread above so grabbed my Medusa and realized I don't have a donor with known good bios I can pull so I download one from Badcaps,

Then realized I have no clue how to connect the Medusa to the pc to add the bios to the Medusa?
The manual is a bit vague and I cant seem to find any other info or videos explaining how I do this,
I know I connect the medusa in that small slot under the screen with either this black or blue cable I have with it but what do I connect it to?

Please help :)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> black screen after Tiresias?
threads.message:
Medusa comes with a DIP-8 adapter, to insert into any USB programmer.
The secondary slot (under the screen), connects directly with Medusa SPI ROM (8MB).
